alert.note: Alert for Knott; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 10:49AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Letcher, southeastern Knott and southwestern Pike Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1049 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Van, or near Whitesburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Whitesburg, Bellcraft and Marlowe around 1055 AM EDT. Southdown, Colly, Ermine, Lucastown, Polly, Lester, Democrat, Oven Fork and Eolia around 1100 AM EDT. Millstone, Winters, Farraday, Thornton, Sergent, Craftsville, Mayking and Deane around 1105 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fleming-Neon, Whitaker, Neon Junction, Tolliver Town, Wright, Seco, Chip, Cromona, Horn, Baker, Jenkins, Fishpond Lake, Payne Gap, Potters Fork, Haymond, Dunham, Lowndes, Gaskill, Burdine and McRoberts. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
